intro: Fuirena ciliata, commonly known as the silky filbert, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, oval leaves with ciliate margins. The plant produces clusters of white to pink flowers in spring, followed by edible, nut-like fruits. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or open woodland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruits, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
